meanings.definition: Insisting on immediate attention or obedience
meanings.sent1: The teacher's peremptory tone made the students quickly sit down.
meanings.sent2: Her peremptory command left no room for delay.
meanings.sent3: The peremptory cat demanded to be fed right meow!
meanings.sent4: His peremptory gesture silenced the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The peremptory alarm jolted everyone awake.

meanings.definition: Final and not able to be changed
meanings.sent1: The judge's peremptory decision ended the case abruptly.
meanings.sent2: The peremptory verdict was accepted without question.
meanings.sent3: The peremptory lock clicked shut, sealing the box forever.
meanings.sent4: The peremptory sunset marked the end of a perfect day.
meanings.sent5: The peremptory contract was signed and sealed.

meanings.definition: Decisive and leaving no opportunity for debate
meanings.sent1: His peremptory statement ended the argument immediately.
meanings.sent2: The peremptory answer left no room for further questions.
meanings.sent3: The peremptory referee's call settled the game once and for all.
meanings.sent4: Her peremptory choice of dessert surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The peremptory thunderclap signaled the start of the storm.
